intro: Navarretia floribunda, commonly known as the Sierra snowplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Navarretia floribunda is a short-lived perennial that plays an important role in its native ecosystem.
